meanings.definition: Students in their second year of high school or college.
meanings.sent1: Sophomores at school study hard for their exams.
meanings.sent2: I made friends with a group of sophomores in my class.
meanings.sent3: The sophomores organized a fun talent show for the school.
meanings.sent4: In the play, the sophomores represented the future generation.
meanings.sent5: The sophomores' enthusiasm for learning was contagious.

meanings.definition: A person in their second year of a particular activity or experience.
meanings.sent1: As a sophomore in dance class, she improved her technique.
meanings.sent2: He felt more confident as a sophomore in his job.
meanings.sent3: The sophomore baker tried a new recipe with surprising results.
meanings.sent4: She approached the project with a sophomore's fresh perspective.
meanings.sent5: The sophomore swimmer broke a personal record in the race.
